description: Residents report persistent issues with human/animal feces, used syringes, and trash accumulation. Sean Miller, a local resident, developed the SnapCrap app to expedite cleanup requests due to daily hazards.
Department of Public Works investigators prioritize this area due to recurring illegal dumping. Fines up to $1,000 are issued, with outreach efforts to educate businesses/residents.
Ranked among worst areas for particulate pollution in the American Lung Association's 2024 report, with elevated cancer risks linked to industrial emissions.
City crews collected 36,000+ pounds of trash in one week (September 2024), addressing chronic issues of furniture, bicycles, and hazardous waste left on sidewalks.
Deployment of $20,900 'Soft Square' trash cans with QR codes for public feedback. Residents criticize excessive spending amid ongoing litter problems.

Resident reports constant illegal dumping with 30 identified hotspots in their area, contributing to 18,000 tons of annual street trash. Neighborhood ranked 2nd dirtiest in U.S. per 2024 LawnStarter survey.
Persistent fecal contamination prompting weekly steam-cleaning. 24/7 pressure-washing crews deployed with portable units. One-quarter of all 24-hour bathroom flushes occur overnight in this zone.

location: Mid-Market Neighborhood (1355 Market St, former X HQ)
description: Vacant retail spaces and abandoned items near X's former headquarters. The Market food hall reports 20-30% sales drop with 'For Rent' signs proliferating. 62% office vacancy rate in district.
Ranked 12th worst for ozone days, 7th for 24-hour particle pollution, and 5th for annual particle pollution in 2024 'State of the Air' report. Over 90% of residents face failing air quality grades.
36,000 lbs of weekly trash removal from homeless encampments, including hazardous materials. Public works teams report daily challenges with blocked sidewalks and storm drain contamination.

location: Clement Street near Green Apple Books (6th Ave & Clement St), Richmond District
description: Approximately a dozen overflowing trash bags and broken furniture illegally dumped in front of businesses, causing accessibility issues. Investigators found documents linking waste to nearby residences.

location: 300 block of Hyde Street (Hyde & Eddy St), Tenderloin
description: Persistent feces, used syringes, and trash on sidewalks dubbed 'dirtiest block in SF.' Residents report daily hazards for pedestrians.
Regular dumping of construction debris, household waste, and hazardous materials. City issued $1,000 fines to repeat offenders.
Non-functional public bin attracts illegal dumping, creating wheelchair access barriers. Repeated 311 requests unresolved.
Residents fined for visible garbage bins despite lack of garage storage. DPW enforced 2006 ordinance requiring hidden bins.

location: Larkin St between O'Farrell St & Golden Gate Ave, Tenderloin
description: 36,000+ pounds of trash collected weekly near encampments, including hazardous waste. Cleanup crews report challenges due to ownership disputes over belongings.
Makeshift employee bedrooms with trash accumulation reported. DBI investigated zoning violations for converting office space to residential use.
